title: Possibly the worst mid lane match up in the game
body:
I just played a game as Orianna against a Yasuo.

His Q has quite a large hitbox. 
His W blocks my ball and auto attacks, can be abused to stop me from last hitting (which he did).
Try to ult him, he just dashes out of it with his E.

Don't you think Orianna needs a slight buff? maybe a buff to her ball speed and ult range can make her a more viable pick.
Orianna is one of the more complicated champs to play but her carry potential isn't really that good when compared to simplier champs like LeBlanc and Katarina.

I'm looking to make her my go-to mid laner but I don't know if I should just learn a different Champion instead.

replies.body: Yasuo is the 2nd hardest and 6th weakest champ in the game, losing to him is only possible if you get severely outplayed.

> [{quoted}](name=Lajneen,realm=EUW,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=kJvfKbuX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-03T09:57:06.251+0000)
>
> Yasuo is the 2nd hardest and 6th weakest champ in the game, losing to him is only possible if you get severely outplayed.

I would like to know where you get the numbers from, and the reliability of such stats.
The official list.
What list? lol
the _official_ one
6 is a multiple of 3, 2 is 1 behind 3 and the word official is mentioned twice. Illuminati confirmed.
I LOL'D
lol every1 who isn't retard know he is 2nd hardest champ after lee
Someone's been watching some Jeremy GC
try playing them

I have....

And I didn't exactly disagree with you lmao


Although I think Azir, Yasuo and Lee Sin could all easily be eligible for 1st, 2nd and 3rd place for hardest champion in the game. For me personally, I find Azir to be the hardest.

azir is slightly mechanical, but once you know how to properly summon and command, he becomes quite easy

ps, I have no idea who the hell Jeremy GC is

He's a Youtuber who posted a video of the top 10 hardest champions in League of Legends (I get really bored on the train)

He ranked Azir 3rd, Yasuo 2nd and Lee 1st.

Yeah Azir is easier when you have a well put together comp with strong CC and a good peeling front line, without these things, I feel like his difficulty increases tenfold.
I find zed the hardest actually, you have to position everything right or you would get punished hard :\

Azir requires much more positioning to use his sand soldier damage though. Like zed can jump in and out, but Azir has to stay in a combat range to actually put out his famous dps. Zed can blink with his shadows, but Azir has to position his sand soldiers beforehand to make a big play like the shurima shuffle and he has to be careful nothing get's in the way of his flight path otherwise he's now in a very very bad position with no escapes. Azir's damage is more awkward and after the nerfs from proplay, less. He's not got much in the way of defensive peel outside of his ult and if enemies dash through his sandsoldier ranges, he's got 1 spell to reposition them, which is also his primary form of offense, so if he wastes it and the enemy get's close he's pretty screwed. Also just like zed shadows, you need to manage the placement of your sand soldiers and how much stock of them you have since if they're out of place you'll do no damage and on top of that you have to make sure the lines between them and you is clear in case you need to use your mobility spell e, since it can be blocked by champions.

Have you played both Azir and Zed? 
I know I haven't played much of either myself but I've tried them out and even though I had alot of difficulty playing zed I felt I could pull off some of the basics and he felt decently strong, but with Azir, even though I spent alot longer learning him, I still felt underpowered and overwhelmed when I was playing him, even into favourable matchups.

I've played both. Have not played Azir in a long time so I don't know what nerfs has done to him. They are both hard champions and only reason why low elo say they are noob champions is because they do not have a single idea of how to counter him. I don't find yasuo hard tbh ( I USED TO MAIN HIM), all you have to is dash in and dash out, all you have to do is maintain the use of dashes for every minion. I literally carried a game with yasuo the other day, I built PD, IE , BT , HYDRA and bersk boots with Bloodlust keystone. Told my team to go bait dragon while I soloed baron. Ended up 1 v 4 the enemy before I died and my team just had to push lol

haha I'm low elo true, but I respect a good yasou, and I can punish a bad one very hard. He's a very hard matchup for some champions and a pretty easy one in lower elo for other champions. I don't play midlane but as long as he's not lastpicked (I'll generally try to see him banned if I'm an early pick, since convincing low elo players to ban yasou is a piece of cake), it's not especially hard to counter pick him. Especially since tank yasou is less of a thing now. I find yasou a case of have a counterpick or some way to shut him down and then he's not an issue, or don't have a way to kill him and lose. Yasou is extremely strong against uncoordinated teams though and as a skillcap champion you just have to realise that sometimes the yasou just isn't someone you can kill unless he's dumb enough to run in solo into a teamfight. 

Yasou was for quite a time, my least favourite matchup champion, but over time, my hate has turned into understanding of how to counter him.
A good yasuo can decide the game

If your champ gets countered, it doesn't mean he/she needs a buff, it means you don't play him/her into this matchup.
Try Heimer into Syndra Rofl
or into sion. 'These turrets aren't here to help you. They're here to help me.'
"You don't want to push that lane, you want a river ward!"

Orianna is a strong champion if played right. Since his e makes him really hard to hit, you should just focus on csing with your ball and making him push your lane. So if he pushes it's a free gank for your jungler, you guys should be able to kill him relatively easy.

E then R then flash right after to yas it works :)  orianna is a game turner, if u land her ult successfully then u can change the tides of a team battle however if u miss it, it could screw everything up... shes is risky but she is one of the best mid champs.

lol you retard? his q is THE SMALLEST GOD DAMN SKILLSHOT HITBOX IN THE GAME

stop complaining because your bad
Are you forreal? Ori is like my go to against Yas. Ori is one of the best matchups you can get going into Yasuo lol
